headline.main: Argentina's Emiliano Grillo Wins Web.com Tour Finals Finale
headline.print_headline: Argentina's Emiliano Grillo Wins Web.com Tour Finals Finale

docs.snippet: Argentina's Emiliano Grillo made a 25-foot birdie putt on the final hole Sunday to win the Web.com Tour Finals-ending Web.Com Tour Championship, and Rob Oppenheim got the last PGA Tour card when Lucas Glover shook up the order with a closing bogey...
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina's Emiliano Grillo made a 25-foot birdie putt on the final hole Sunday to win the Web.com Tour Finals-ending Web.Com Tour Championship, and Rob Oppenheim got the last PGA Tour card when Lucas Glover shook up the order with a closing bogey.

Beloved wife of Alvin for 67 years. Adored mother, grandmother and great-grandmother. Services will be held at Frank E. Campbell Chapel, 1076 Madison Ave., New York City, October 6th at 10:30am.

docs.snippet: HEWES--Jane, passed away peacefully on October 2nd at her home in New York. She was a loving wife, mother, sister and friend as well as a pioneer in the educati- onal consulting field. Pre-deceased by Henry Hewes, her husband of 61 years, Jane is ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
HEWES--Jane, passed away peacefully on October 2nd at her home in New York. She was a loving wife, mother, sister and friend as well as a pioneer in the educati-

onal consulting field. Pre-deceased by Henry Hewes, her husband of 61 years, Jane is survived by her sons, Henry, Tucker and Havelock and six grandchildren, Henry, William, John, Duncan, Daniel and Allise. Her brother, Robert Fowle, lives in Somerset, Bermuda. She founded Jane Hewes Educational Consulting in 1978 and was a founding member of the Independent Educational Consultants Association. We miss her greatly.

docs.snippet: SMITH--Doris H., 96, of Tamarac, FL, passed away on October 3, 2015. Devoted wife of Philip (deceased). Beloved mother of Jeffrey (Barrie) and Michael (Rita). Grandmother of eight grandchildren and twelve great-grandchildren. Loving sister of Glad...
docs.lead_paragraph:
SMITH--Doris H.,

96, of Tamarac, FL, passed away on October 3, 2015. Devoted wife of Philip (deceased). Beloved mother of Jeffrey (Barrie) and Michael (Rita). Grandmother of eight grandchildren and twelve great-grandchildren. Loving sister of Gladys and the late Seymour and Howard. A wonderful lady - you will be sorely missed. Graveside service.

docs.snippet: LYNCH--Josephine D. (nee Dexter) died at home Monday, July 27, 2015 in Gladwyne, PA. Beloved wife of the late David B. Lynch, who died in 2001, and sister of the late Polly Newbold, who died in 2010, Joedy was the devoted mother of David, Tina Fie...
docs.lead_paragraph:
LYNCH--Josephine D.

(nee Dexter) died at home Monday, July 27, 2015 in Gladwyne, PA. Beloved wife of the late David B. Lynch, who died in 2001, and sister of the late Polly Newbold, who died in 2010, Joedy was the devoted mother of David, Tina Fiertz (Stuart) and Linda (Kevin Johnson), and devoted grandmother of Henry, Callie, Mimi, Louisa, Theo, Lucy and Annie. She attended The Shipley School and graduated in 1948 from St. Timothy's School in Stevenson, MD. In the 1950's Joedy was an accessories editor for Harper's Bazaar magazine in New York City. A memorial service will be held on Friday, October 9, 2015 at 4pm at St. Christopher's Church, 226 Righter's Mill Road, Gladwyne, PA. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in her name to The Bryn Mawr Hospital Foundation, Bryn Mawr, PA. Online condolences: donohuefuneralhome.com

docs.snippet: HARNETT--Bertram, age 92, passed away peacefully at his home in Boca Raton, Florida on October 1. He is survived by his dear wife of 71 years, Ruth, and children, Andrea, a retired Magistrate Judge in Washington, DC; David, a psychiatrist in Medfo...
docs.lead_paragraph:
HARNETT--Bertram,

age 92, passed away peacefully at his home in Boca Raton, Florida on October 1. He is survived by his dear wife of 71 years, Ruth, and children, Andrea, a retired Magistrate Judge in Washington, DC; David, a psychiatrist in Medford, Mass.; James, a retired lawyer in Madison, Wisconsin; six grandchildren and one great granddaughter. He was predeceased by his brother, Joel, of New York and Arizona. Raised in Brooklyn, New York, he graduated from Brooklyn College and Columbia Law School. He taught and practiced law in New York and Florida for over 60 years. He wrote two legal treatises and other legal works of more general interest. He served as Nassau County Attorney from 1962 to 1963 and as a Judge on the New York State Supreme Court from 1968 to 1977. He was the prime moving force in the establishment of the Cohen Children's Medical Center of New York in New Hyde Park, NY. He was a man of great intellect and accomplishment and led a long, full life. He was known for a keen sense of justice, an engaging sense of humor, and endless curiosity. He travelled the world and read voraciously. He charmed people of all ages until his final days. Most of all, he loved and was devoted to his family. He will be missed terribly. A funeral service will be held at Temple Beth-El in Boca Raton, Florida at 2:00pm on October 7. In lieu of flowers, donations may be sent to North Shore LIJ Cohen Children's Medical Center in New Hyde Park, NY or to the Strobis Glaucoma Foundation in Boca Raton.

docs.lead_paragraph:
VENTLINE--Pfc Lukas,

of Detroit, 23, Vietnam, February 18, 1968, a half-century gone, a pawn, with 58,000 other U.S. loyals in TET futile battle. Eternal Rest.
